page.title: 09FARMING IN THE AMBLE AREA
page.content: Most of the{farms}in the Amble area practice{mixed farming,}with an emphasis of{cereals such as wheat and {barley.}The general{size averages 300 {acres,}usually{family owned or {tenanted from the Duke of Northumber- {land. Beef and sheep}are also bought from the{upland farms}to fatten on the {rich pastures of the Northumberland {plain. Winter feed}for stock is supplemented by{silage,}the first cut being taken in the early summer. There are two{dairy herds}in the Amble area serving the town and the conurbations of the south-east, while a{poultry {farm supplies eggs and meat.}A recent expansion of{oil-seed rape}has taken place. A proportion of the area's farmland is temporarily lost to the {open-cast mining}operations in the area for up to{seven years,}after which it is{restored.
